definitions.definition: that happens or is done most of the time or in most cases
definitions.sensetop: usual for somebody/somethingit is usual to do somethingit is usual for somebody/something to do somethingusual in somebody/something

examples.text: This is the usual way of doing it.
He came home later than usual.
He didn't sound like **his usual** happy **self**.
She sat in her usual seat at the back.
They asked me why I wanted the job and why I thought I was suitable—you know, the usual thing.
You need to enter all the usual stuff—name, address, credit card details.
Our usual practice is to ask for references from previous employers.
She made all the usual excuses.
This weather is not usual for this time of year.
It is usual to start a speech by thanking everybody for coming.
examples.contextForm: it is usual to do something

examples.text: It is not usual for a head of government to attend a meeting like this.
examples.contextForm: it is usual for somebody/something to do something

examples.text: This kind of behaviour is far from usual in children of this age.
It's usual for the man to propose marriage.
It's very usual for people to leave books and papers behind.
The metal can then be painted in the usual way.
He was sitting in his usual chair by the window.
It is usual for the employer to pay the costs.
She arrived at the usual time.

definitions.definition: what usually happens; what you usually have, especially the drink that you usually have
in the way that is normal or usual; as often happens

examples.text: Everyone blamed me as per usual.

definitions.definition: in the same way as what happens most of the time or in most cases

examples.text: Steve, as usual, was the last to arrive.
As usual at that hour, the place was deserted.
Despite her problems, she carried on working as usual.
Despite the problems staff arrived for work as usual.

definitions.definition: a way of saying that things will continue as normal despite a difficult situation

examples.text: It's business as usual at the factory, even while investigators sift through the bomb wreckage.

definitions.definition: the people you would usually expect to do something or be included in something

examples.text: She thanked all the usual suspects in her acceptance speech: her family, the director, the cast and the crew.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French, or from late Latin usualis, from Latin usus ‘a use’, from uti ‘to use’.
